title.narrative: Pakistan: Second Sindh Education Sector Project

description.narrative: The project supports the Sindh Government's Second Sindh Education Sector Reform Program (SERP II). The Project Development Objective is to raise school participation by improving sector governance and accountability and strengthening administrative systems, and measure student achievement.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :FA Reference: Section I.C, Schedule 2PA Reference: Section I.D of the Schedule | Description :Environmental andSocial Safeguards: Activities under the Project (i) are carried out in accordance with the Environmental and Social ManagementFramework and (ii) do not entail involuntary land acquisition or give rise to Affected Persons. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :PA Reference: Section 111.2 of the Schedule | Description :(i) Maintenance of a procurement documentation andrecord keeping system; (ii) disclosure on RSU website of all relevant procurement activities and status of implementation ofcontracts financed through project EEPs and TA, textbook publication and textbook transportation contracts signed by the Sindh TextBook Board, and civil works and furniture contracts signed by the districts for school infra | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :PA Reference: Section I.A of the Schedule | Description :Implementation arrangements: Requiring: (i) themaintenance of relevant Project management structures, including (1) the Steering Committee for SERPII, (2) Reform Support Unit(RSU), (3) the Economic Reform Unit (ERU), and (4) Region Reform Oversight Committees (RROCs) in all provincial regions; and (ii)establishment and thereafter maintenance of the Local Support Units (LSUs) in each district. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :PA Reference: Section I.A.2 (c) of the Schedule | Description :RSU Staffing: Retention within the RSU of (a) aProcurement Officer, (b) a Contract Management Officer, (c) a Financial Management Officer, (d) a Financial Reporting Officer, and(e) an Environmental Coordinator. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :PA Reference: Section I.C of the Schedule | Description :Project Implementation Manual: Update of the ProjectImplementation Manual (PIM) in form and substance satisfactory to the Association. | Due Date :10-Aug-2014

Finance Agreement :PA Reference: Section I.E of the Schedule | Description :Performance based incentive plan: Implementation of thePerformance-based Incentive Plan for government officials posted at RSU and proposed Local Support Units (LSUs) and the submissionof the monthly staff performance evaluation reports for incentive payments to the Bank on a quarterly basis. | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :PA Reference: Section I.F of the Schedule | Description :Complaints Management Systems: Provision requiring theprocurement and Sindh government to ensure that RSU and SEF individually procure and customize by establishment and maintenance ofaweb-based complaints management system for handling SERP-II and PPRS program related complaints. | Due Date :15-Feb-2015

Finance Agreement :PA Reference: Section I.G of the Schedule | Description :Fiduciary guidelines: USe of (i) nonsalary budgets bygovernment schools without Drawing and Disbursing authority; (ii) nonsalary budgets by government schools with Drawing andDisbursing authority, (iii) grants by School Management Committees for government schools, and(iv) subsidies by SEF PPRS programschools, in accordance with the applicable financial management and procurement guidelines. | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :PA Reference: Section I.H of the Schedule | Description :Deletion of SEMIS codes of merged schools: Permanentcancellation and deletion of the Sindh Education Management System (SEMIS) identification codes of all government schoolsthat aremerged under the School Consolidation Policy. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :PA Reference: Section II.A.2 of the Schedule | Description :SERP-II progress reports from RROCs: Preparation andsubmission to the Association of SERP-II progress reports by the Region ReformOversight Committees following agreed instructionsand template and covering implementation progress and performance in identified initiatives and activities as well asthe full setof minutes of meetings held. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :PA Reference: Section II.B.4 and 5 of the Schedule | Description :Audit Reports: Preparation and submission tothe Association of: (i) audit reports covering the overall budgetary expenditures of the Sindh government for its fiscal year; and(ii) the audit report of SEF. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :PA Reference: Section II.C of the Schedule | Description :Budget Execution Reports: Preparation and submissionto the Association of quarterly consolidated budget execution reports setting out values of budgets, actual expenditures incurred,per budget line, for the whole education sector, with a cover note summarizing budget allocations and utilization in the EligibleExpenditure Programs for monitoring project implementation progress. | Frequency :Quarterly
